In this short article we are going to create a quote web server in Go . The server would call another API to get random quote upon requests. This is a good example to demonstrate the use of context package for error propagation.

1. Using Go modules

We are going to use go modules to create the project outside of GOPATH. Go modules comes with go 1.11 or later versions of go. It's a tool used to initiate a go project in a directory that is outside of GOPATH. It keeps track of the packages you use in your code in a file called go.mod. So let's get started !

  1. Create a directory called quoteServer outside of GOPATH then CD into that directory . 
$ mkdir quoteServer
$ cd quoteServer

This creates a file called go.mod that's going to hold the packages you use and the version of each one.
